intro: Bambusa bambos, commonly known as the golden bamboo, is a fast-growing grass species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender culms that can reach heights of up to 15 meters. The plant has a dense,丛生 growth habit and produces panicles of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are long and narrow, often used in traditional crafts and as fodder.
